short-title.#text:
Stronger Enforcement of Civil
			 Penalties Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Updated civil
			 money penalties for securities laws violations

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 8A(g)(2) of the Securities Act
			 of 1933

text.#text:
$1,000,000 for a
				natural person or $10,000,000 for any other person;

the amount of
				losses incurred by victims as a result of the act or omission, if—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
involved fraud, deceit, manipulation, or
				deliberate or reckless disregard of a regulatory requirement; and

text.#text:
the act or
				omission described in

such act or
				omission directly or indirectly resulted in—

substantial
				pecuniary gain to the person who committed the act or
				omission.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the amount of
				penalty for each such act or omission shall not exceed the greater of—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 8A(g)(2) of the Securities Act of 1933

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the maximum
				amount of penalty for each such act or omission shall be 3 times the otherwise
				applicable amount in such subparagraphs if, within the 5-year period preceding
				such act or omission, the person who committed the act or omission was
				criminally convicted for securities fraud or became subject to a judgment or
				order imposing monetary, equitable, or administrative relief in any

action alleging fraud by that
				person.

is amended by adding at the end the
			 following:

				such violation, the defendant was criminally convicted for securities fraud or
				became subject to a judgment or order imposing monetary, equitable, or
				administrative relief in any

action alleging fraud by that
				defendant.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 20(d) of the Securities Act of 1933

quote.#text:
a Federal court injunction or a bar obtained or entered by
			 the Commission under this title,

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be a separate offense, except that in the
				case of a violation through a continuing failure to comply with such injunction
				or order, each day of the failure to comply with the injunction or order shall
				be deemed a separate offense.

text.#text:
Each separate violation of an injunction or order
				described in

a
				Federal court injunction obtained pursuant to this title;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
pursuant to this title that bars, suspends,
				places limitations on the activities or functions of, or prohibits the
				activities of, a person; or

text.#text:
an order entered
				or obtained by the

a
				cease-and-desist order entered by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall apply with respect to any action to
				enforce—

current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To enhance civil penalties under the Federal securities
		  laws, and for other purposes.
